intro: Ruehssia gillespieae, commonly known as the Gillespiea ruehssia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense cluster, which bloom during the spring season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, facing threats from habitat loss and climate change. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
